meanings.definition: Resembling an echo in sound; reverberating.
meanings.sent1: The cave was so echoey that every word spoken bounced back.
meanings.sent2: The hallway had an echoey quality that made footsteps sound louder.
meanings.sent3: The echoey room made it seem like there were invisible voices whispering secrets.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the echoey chamber like a symphony of joy.
meanings.sent5: The echoey canyon amplified the howl of the wind, creating a haunting melody.

meanings.definition: Having a quality of sound that is reflected and repeated.
meanings.sent1: The echoey microphone distorted the singer's voice during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The old building had an echoey acoustics that made music sound magical.
meanings.sent3: The echoey laughter of the children filled the room with happiness.
meanings.sent4: Her words had an echoey effect, lingering in the air long after she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The echoey sound of the bell resonated through the empty hallways, creating a ghostly atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The echoey mountains reflected the calls of the hikers, creating a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent2: The echoey chamber bounced back even the softest whispers.
meanings.sent3: The echoey room made it impossible to keep a secret.
meanings.sent4: His echoey voice filled the empty space with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The echoey cave amplified the sound of dripping water, creating a mysterious ambiance.
